discover.instruction: Read this natural conversation. Notice how words are omitted or replaced.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай этот естественный разговор. Обрати внимание, как слова опускаются или заменяются.

content.text: A: Are you coming to the party? B: I'd like <highlight>to</highlight>, but I can't. A: Why not? Everyone else <highlight>is</highlight>. B: I know they <highlight>are</highlight>, but I have work. A: Can't you finish <highlight>it</highlight> tomorrow? B: I wish I <highlight>could</highlight>. A: You said you <highlight>would</highlight>. B: I know I <highlight>did</highlight>. A: Some came early and <highlight>some</highlight> late. B: <highlight>Those who did</highlight> missed the surprise. A: The food was good, or <highlight>so</highlight> I've heard. B: <highlight>So</highlight> it was. Better than expected, <highlight>apparently</highlight>.
content.question: What full forms do these shortened expressions represent?
content.question_ru: Какие полные формы представляют эти сокращённые выражения?

theory.title: Ellipsis and Substitution for Natural Flow
theory.title_ru: Эллипсис и замещение для естественного потока речи

points.rule: Ellipsis after 'to': I'd like to (go). She wants to (come). I don't want to (stay).
points.rule_ru: Эллипсис после 'to': I'd like to (go). She wants to (come). I don't want to (stay).
points.example: A: Will you help? B: I'd like to. (= I'd like to help)

points.rule: Auxiliary ellipsis: She can swim and he can (swim) too. I will if you will.
points.rule_ru: Эллипсис вспомогательного: She can swim and he can (swim) too. I will if you will.
points.example: A: Have you finished? B: No, but I will. (= I will finish)

points.rule: Substitution with 'so/not': I think so. I hope not. It appears so.
points.rule_ru: Замещение с 'so/not': I think so. I hope not. It appears so.
points.example: A: Is it raining? B: I believe so. / I don't think so.

points.rule: Substitution with 'do so': He promised to help and he did so willingly.
points.rule_ru: Замещение с 'do so': He promised to help and he did so willingly.
points.example: We were asked to remain and we did so without complaint.

points.rule: Substitution with 'one/ones': I'll take the red one. These ones are better.
points.rule_ru: Замещение с 'one/ones': I'll take the red one. These ones are better.
points.example: Which book? The one on the table. The blue ones are mine.

notice.instruction: Identify what has been omitted or substituted.
notice.instruction_ru: Определи, что было опущено или заменено.

tasks.text:
Conversations:

1. A: Are you going to apply? B: I'm planning to.
2. A: Has she arrived? B: No, but she will soon.
3. A: Is it going to rain? B: I hope not.
4. A: Which pen do you want? B: The blue one.
5. A: He said he'd help. B: And he did so without hesitation.
6. A: Can you come? B: I wish I could.
7. A: Some agreed and some didn't.
8. A: The exam was difficult. B: So I've heard.
9. A: You should exercise more. B: I know I should.
10. A: Is the meeting cancelled? B: It appears so.

notice.reflection_question: Why is ellipsis important for natural-sounding English?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему эллипсис важен для естественно звучащего английского?

produce.instruction: Write a natural dialogue using ellipsis and substitution to avoid repetition.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши естественный диалог, используя эллипсис и замещение, чтобы избежать повторения.
prompts: Write a conversation about weekend plans
Create a dialogue about choosing products in a store
Write a discussion about whether something will happen
Compose a conversation with promises and agreements
produce.example:
A: Are you coming to the party on Saturday?
B: I'd like to, but I'm not sure if I can.
A: Why not? Everyone else is.
B: I know they are. I have to work.
A: Can't you finish early?
B: I wish I could. I promised my boss I would stay.
A: You could do so another day.
B: I suggested that but he said no.
A: That's unfortunate. Some came late last time.
B: Did they? I wasn't one of those who did.
A: The food was great, or so I've heard.
B: So it was. Better than expected, apparently.

input_flood.description: Read 5 dialogues with natural ellipsis and substitution.

texts.title: Weekend Plans
texts.content: A: Are you going to the concert? B: I'd love to, but I can't. A: Why not? Sarah is and Tom is too. B: I know they are. I have to work. A: On Saturday? B: Apparently so. A: You could call in sick. B: I wish I could. A: Would Mark cover for you? B: He might. I'll ask if he can. A: I hope so. It won't be the same without you.

texts.title: Shopping Decisions
texts.content: A: Which laptop do you recommend? B: The silver one is popular, but the black one is faster. A: Is the black one worth the extra cost? B: I think so. A: Can I try both? B: Of course you can. A: I was planning to buy the cheaper one. B: Many do, but those who choose the premium model rarely regret doing so. A: I'll take the black one then. B: Good choice. Would you like a case for it? A: Yes, the leather one please.

texts.title: Project Discussion
texts.content: A: Has the client approved the proposal? B: Not yet, but they will. A: Are you sure? B: I believe so. They seemed positive. A: Will they sign today? B: They might. I hope so anyway. A: Some clients take weeks to decide. B: I know they do. A: You said you'd call them. B: I did, and I did so twice. A: And? B: They promised to respond by Friday. A: Let's hope they will.

texts.title: Health Conversation
texts.content: A: Are you feeling better? B: A bit, but not as much as I'd like to. A: Did you take your medicine? B: Yes, I did. A: Have you eaten? B: I haven't been able to. A: You need to. B: I know I do. A: Will you see the doctor again? B: I might. If I'm not better by tomorrow, I will. A: Do you think it's serious? B: I hope not. A: So do I.

texts.title: Travel Plans
texts.content: A: Have you booked the flights? B: Not yet, but I'm going to. A: Which airline? The budget one or the premium one? B: I'm considering both. The cheaper one saves money. A: But the better one is more comfortable. B: So it is. A: Can we afford the expensive one? B: We can if we want to. A: Then let's do so. B: Are you sure you want to? A: I think so. Life's too short. B: Indeed it is.
